text: Hi, I’m Francis, the host of this show "Cooking with Dog."
When I went back to my hometown last month, one of my neighbors gave me these fabulous bulbs of garlic.
Today we are making a delicious steak using lots of garlic.
First, let's prepare the sauce.
Combine the soy sauce, mirin,
sake
and grated garlic.
Stir to mix.
Next, add the olive oil to a pan.
Put in the coarsely chopped garlic clove.
Turn on the burner and saute it on low heat.
You can tilt the pan to submerge the garlic in the oil.
When the garlic is golden brown, remove and set it aside.
Let's prepare the meat.
Make numerous shallow cuts along the bottom of the steak.
Then, make cuts perpendicular to the initial cuts,
creating a grid pattern.
Lightly season both sides of the steak with salt and pepper.
You want to start with the meat at room temperature
so take it out of the fridge 20 to 30 minutes prior to cooking.
Now, heat the pan on high heat.
Remove the remaining garlic oil, leaving 1 teaspoon in the pan.
Place the steak onto the pan.
Cook the top side first so that you can present
the beautifully browned side when served.
Brown the steak on high heat for about 1 minute and flip it over.
Cook the bottom side on high heat for 10 seconds.
Then, reduce the heat to low
and cook for an additional 10 seconds.
Remove and place onto a cooling rack.
Place the hot pan onto a dampened towel to slightly cool.
If there are any burnt pieces,
wipe them away with a paper towel.
Then cover the steak with aluminum foil.
Let it sit for about 5 minutes
and allow the meat to reabsorb the juices.
Now, add the sauce to the pan.
Reheat the pan and bring it to a boil.
Stir to mix and reduce the garlic sauce until slightly thickened.
Now, it is ready.
Pour the sauce into a bowl.
Now, the steak has re-absorbed the juices.
Cut the steak into smaller pieces.
Allowing the meat to reabsorb the juices is important
because it will help avoid losing the precious juices when cut.
Place the steak onto a plate
along with the baby spinach and boiled mixed vegetables.
Sprinkle on the fried garlic bits.
This steak with lots of garlic will definitely revitalize your energy!
Pour on the sauce and enjoy the delicious steak!
Making the cuts on the bottom in a grid pattern
will make the meat extra tender so everyone can enjoy the steak.
Delicious!
We used a cut from the bottom round
but you can also use beef tenderloin or sirloin in this recipe.
Good luck in the kitchen!
I asked 3 of my friends to make the appetizers and dessert that go great with this garlic steak.
They look scrumptious! Be sure to check them out.
That’s some loud thunder!
